intro: Senecio yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
